prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism First, construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0524, 0.0]. Now, let's create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 1. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines. - Start Point of line_1: [0.0, 0.0] - End Point of line_1: [0.75, 0.0] - Start Point of line_2: [0.75, 0.0] - End Point of line_2: [0.75, 0.3293] - Start Point of line_3: [0.75, 0.3293] - End Point of line_3: [0.0, 0.3293] - Start Point of line_4: [0.0, 0.3293] - End Point of line_4: [0.0, 0.0] The sketch consists of one face, which has only one loop. To scale the 2D sketch, use the sketch_scale value 0.75. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using Euler angles and the translation vector determined by the coordinate system. Now, let's extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. 1. Enter the "extrude_depth_towards_normal" value from the extrusion data: 0.0262 2. Enter the "extrude_depth_opposite_normal" value from the extrusion data: 0.0262 The resulting prism has a height of 0.75 units, a width of 0.0524 units, and a length (measured along the longest dimension) of 0.75 units: - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.0524 - Height: 0.75</description>
